CWEs: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
description: The function is vulnerable to command injection. The 'command' and 'args' variables are directly used in the error message without any sanitization or validation. If these variables contain malicious values, they can lead to command injection attacks.
